channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What those who volunteered with Jimmy Carter for Habitat for Humanity say about him
item.description: Jimmy Carter's legacy lives on through Habitat for Humanity, says those who volunteered with him.

item.title: Savage tactics have swung the Ukraine war in Russia's favor
Jimmy Carter: Many evolutions for a centenarian ‘citizen of the world’
item.description: The 39th and longest-lived U.S. president, James Earl Carter Jr., died Sunday at the age of 100. His life ended where it began, in Plains, Georgia.

item.title: Nine million workers are getting a raise on January 1. Here's where.
item.description: The federal minimum has held at $7.25 an hour since 2009, but an increasing number of states are upping their base pay for workers.

item.title: Foreign leaders react to former President Jimmy Carter's death
item.description: World leaders have offered their condolences after the death of former President Jimmy Carter at the age of 100.
